content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Maryam Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello Maryam, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm looking for the highest price possible for this beautiful unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center. What's your offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Let's start with 500 euros. It's a fair price considering the location and condition of the apartment.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand that you want to get a good deal, but 500 euros is a bit too low for this apartment. It's a newly built, unfurnished apartment in the city center, and the market rate for a place like this is around 700-800 euros per month.

I'm willing to negotiate, but I can't go too low. How about we meet in the middle and say 600 euros? That's a fair price for both of us, and it will ensure that you'll have a comfortable and modern place to live.

What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That sounds more reasonable. I'll accept 600 euros, but I have a question. Is it possible to reduce the price by 20 euros since I will be a dependable tenant and I always pay my bills on time?
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand that you want to get the best deal possible, and I appreciate your desire to be a dependable tenant. However, I'm afraid I can't reduce the price by 20 euros. The price of 600 euros is already below market rate, and I can't afford to go any lower.

That being said, I'm willing to offer you a discount if you're willing to sign a longer lease. If you commit to staying in the apartment for at least a year, I can offer you a 50 euro discount per month. This way, you'll be able to enjoy a lower rent price while also providing me with the stability of a long-term tenant.

What do you think? Is a year-long lease something you'd be interested in?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you for the offer. A year-long lease sounds like a good option for me. I accept the price of 550 euros per month.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! A year-long lease at 550 euros per month is a fair price for both of us. I'll draw up the contract and have it ready for you to sign when you move in.

In the meantime, I'll give you a tour of the apartment and answer any questions you may have. And, as I mentioned earlier, I'll also provide you with a set of keys for the apartment.

Shall we schedule a time for the tour and key handover? How about tomorrow afternoon at 3 PM?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Tomorrow afternoon at 3 PM sounds perfect. I am looking forward to moving into the new apartment. Thank you for your cooperation, and I am sure we will have a great landlord-tenant relationship.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
You're welcome! I'm glad to hear that you're excited about moving into the apartment. I strive to be a responsive and supportive landlord, and I'm confident that we'll have a positive working relationship.

I'll see you tomorrow afternoon at 3 PM for the tour and key handover. If you have any questions or concerns before then, feel free to reach out to me. I'm always here to help.

Looking forward to meeting you tomorrow!
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
Thank you. I don't have any more questions at the moment. I will see you tomorrow at 3 PM.

[yourname]
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great! I'll see you tomorrow at 3 PM then. Have a good day and I'll talk to you soon.

Bye for now!
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
